We're prepping the release of 1.17.0-preview today: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4593

Backdrop 1.17.0-preview Release checklist · Issue #4593 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Scheduled for September 2nd, 2020 Pre-release tasks Merge commits Create a new minor release milestone Move all unfinished issues to the next minor release milestone Draft Release notes @jenlampton...
I've just updated the "Features planned for version 1.17" section in https://backdropcms.org/roadmap
...please see the list and let me know if you think that any of the other features that got in should be there, or if the order of the ones I included should change.

Tag is cut for 1.17.0-preview: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.17.0-preview

Release 1.17.0-preview · backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop 1.17.0 Preview.

@quicksketch Is a tweet of this nature in order?

We have a preview version of 1.17.0 available today. Official release will be on Sept 15th.

If you are able to help test the preview version, feedback would be welcome.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.17.0-preview
Yeah, but lets wait until the release notes are posted on that page.
Gotcha
...and that's why I want us to have a second "demo" button on the demo page, so that we can ask non-technical people to actually give the new version a spin w/o having to install it themselves.
why not a version selector like simplytest.me does?
How fancy that would be!
It USED to be fancy. Now they've done this:
image.png

@docwilmot I've added your suggestion to https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/577

Create a new demo button and respective landing page for latest HEAD · Issue #577 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We need a way for people to spin up sandboxes with the latest HEAD. This would help us to provide an easy way for people to: test new features in the upcoming minor releases (point people to it aft...
that wasnt quite my suggestion; i'm suggesting a dropdown just like in that image, to install selected versions. we could limit the allowed versions so its not as overwhelming.
never mind, actually saw the issue.

How about this the?: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/705

Demo page: allow selecting from a list of versions to install. · Issue #705 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
@docwilmot in Zulip: why not a version selector like simplytest.me does? ...we could limit the allowed versions so its not as overwhelming.

@klonos @StPaulTim (et al) Jen has been swamped today and hasn't been able to put together the release notes. Would one of you be up for drafting release notes based on the list at https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues?q=is%3Aissue+milestone%3A1.17.0+is%3Aclosed ?

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
I can give it a go.
I'll need about 20 minutes.

Awesome thanks so much Tim! Here's an example: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.16.0-preview

Release 1.16.0-preview · backdrop/backdrop
This is the preview release of Backdrop 1.16.0. Please use this version if you would like to help us test the features in the new version of Backdrop -- prior to the official release on May 15, 202...

If anything is noteworthy from the next bugfix release (https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues?q=is%3Aissue+milestone%3A1.16.3+is%3Aclosed) those items can be good to highlight as well, even though they're not explicitly 1.17.0 fixes.

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
Does anyone know off hand if a database update is necessary with this update?
@StPaulTim Yes DB update is necessary.
@quicksketch - I won't be able to edit the notes myself will I?

I put everything in Google Doc for now:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JVNa9aygCQU1INgLqTSGcRKnMcwG4Pot-9ZWXB8ZoT8/edit?usp=sharing

Mostly ready, but I haven't looked at 1.16 issues yet.
I welcome feedback on how I've organized the items. All 15 tickets from 1.17 are included.
The last two UX issues are from 1.16.3. Not sure if there is anything else on that list worth mentioning.

@quicksketch - I'm correct that I won't be able to do anything more than this, correct?
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JVNa9aygCQU1INgLqTSGcRKnMcwG4Pot-9ZWXB8ZoT8/edit?usp=sharing

Notes for updating: It will be necessary to run the update script (located at /update.php) ...
Looks great @StPaulTim! I'll copy over to GitHub.
Do all bug fixes between now and the 15th go directly into this preview release?
All merges from now until the 15th should be bug-fixes. But yes they all go on top of this release.
Branching-wise 1.17.0-preview is just a point in time on the main 1.x branch. We'll fork for the 1.17.x branch on the 15th.

@StPaulTim https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.17.0-preview release is published! Tweet at your discretion.

Backdrop 1.17.0 Preview.
Note to self - Next time, I should draft release notes in Github/doc issue to preserve formatting.
Yeah, I had to manually reformat it because Google Docs aren't markdown and GitHub doesn't have a WYSIWYG. :\
@stpaultim I usually just post them in a comment on the preview checklist, the formatting checks out there :)
@StPaulTim thanks for handling the release notes! Did you like it? I Signed you up for the release notes on the 15th too :) LMK if you'd rather not do it again :D

It's fine. I think I did it once before.

It's easier when you been as active in the queue as I have been the last 2 months. For the first time, I recognize about 75% of the issues and understand them.
I've pinned the two release issues in the queue to keep them front-and-centre for the next two weeks.

Does anyone have strong feelings about reverting https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4614 ?

Date format for database log messages not always updated, & undefined function date_format_type_options() · Issue #4614 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug New date format for database log messages appears corrupted after update from older versions of backdrop: 1.15.x or earlier. Unrelated, but also: Let's not use _date_form...
I posted a PR that reverts it (because I needed the patch) but we still have time to fix it, so leaving it open for discussion :)
Let's just try and fix the problem
ok @BWPanda would you prefer 3 issues for the 3 problems I've found with it so far, or do you want to tackle them all in one PR?
I keep adding things to that one issue but let me know if that gets too confusing and I can split themout
I'll try the one, but will post in the issue if I think we need to split them out.
I'm working on getting better STR for the update failure.
thank you @BWPanda so far the PR is :thumbs_up:
